body_html:
@yuandong-tian here's a minimal example to get you started:
https://gist.github.com/colesbury/bda55436e67da38c4027459f6d4ab42a

A few important changes:

  • import torch.multiprocessing instead of multiprocessing
  • use 'spawn' context (instead of default 'fork')
  • use mp.Queue, since we don't support passing arguments through mp.Process yet

https://gist.github.com/colesbury/bda55436e67da38c4027459f6d4ab42a
A few important changes:

import torch.multiprocessing instead of multiprocessing
use 'spawn' context (instead of default 'fork')
use mp.Queue, since we don't support passing arguments through mp.Process yet
body:
@yuandong-tian here's a minimal example to get you started:
https://gist.github.com/colesbury/bda55436e67da38c4027459f6d4ab42a

A few important changes:

- import torch.multiprocessing instead of multiprocessing
- use 'spawn' context (instead of default 'fork')
- use mp.Queue, since we don't support passing arguments through mp.Process yet
